question.text: Which one of the following is correctly matched?

solution.text:
Ginger - Rhizomes

Chlamydomonas - asexual reproduction goes through Zoospores, Palmella stage, alpanospores, and hypnospores; sexual reproduction is through isogamy, anisogamy, or oogamy.

Yeast - the most common mode of vegetative growth in yeast is asexual reproduction by budding. Some yeasts, including S. pombe, reproduce by fission instead of budding. 

Bulb: It is a highly reduced disc-like stem. Numerous scaly-leaves grow on the upper surface of the stem or around it, while adventitious roots are produced from the base. The inner scale-leaves are fleshy. Fleshy leaves store food and outer scale-leaves help in protection. The stem has a central terminal bud which gives rise to the aerial shoot. Bulbs of onion are covered with dry membranous sheaths called a tunic. They are called tunicated bulbs. E.g. Onion, garlic
